ygData.subject: Re: Our new HTTP stuff has a presence on Codeplex
ygData.msgSnippet: Let me add one more clarification to 3. I said we want to enable REST and not block it. But we don t want to choose the One true REST approach or force it.

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Let me add one more clarification to 3. I said we want to enable REST and
not block it. But we don't want to choose the "One true REST approach" or
force it.

On Sat, Oct 30, 2010 at 4:07 PM, Glenn Block <glenn.block@...> wrote:

> We just launched our new codeplex site <http://wcf.codeplex.com/> which
> includes the stuff I have been chattering about. I delivered a talk on it
> yesterday at the PDC.
>
> In the talk I had 3 goals with relation to REST
>
> 1. To clarify (a bit) what it is an what it isn't.
> 2. To illustrate several concepts. I spoke quite a bit about media types,
> conneg, and showed an illustration of builiding one with hypermedia.
> 3. To make it clear that we are not building a REST framework, but a
> framework for HTTP
>
> information about the site and the talk are below.
>
> site: wcf.codeplex.com
> pdc talk: Go to the player here: http://player.microsoftpdc.com/session we
> are under featured sessions "Building Connected Web Apis for the Highly
> Connected Web"
>
> Thanks again to everyone who has supported us to this point.
>
> Glenn
>

--20cf3054a54dddf5210493dda60d
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
